result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 05-10-2016 02:30 pm

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 1 in 15CF182,  Count 1 in 15CM209,  Count 1 in 15CM218 and  Count 2 in 15CM227.  This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.
Plea hearing at 02-29-2016 01:30 pm
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Fredrickson.  Set for plea only.  PSI will be requested. 2/29/16 at 1:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Fredrickson.  Defendant in custody.  Track with CF case.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, and with Attorney Paul Fredrickson.  Court advised the charges and possible penalties.  Attorney Fredrickson waived the reading of the complaint. NGP entered by court.  PTC & STC dates set.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael T Bearfield
Current: W8866 Decorah Rd, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 05-07-2015)
Prior: 214 S 3rd Street #11, Black River Falls, WI 54615

Defendant appeared without counsel.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant states he has received a copy of the complaint.  Court reviews the charges and potential penalites and explained attorney options.  Court set an adjourned initial appearance for 5-18-15 at 9:30.  $200 signature bond with conditions requested by the State; bond ordered as requested.  Defendant verifies address is correct.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request. 
  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: James B
Adjourned initial appearance at 05-18-2015 09:30 am
